column1: hits a lovely length - not full enough to drive, but nowhere near short either- and Guptill just blocks it out
straying on the pads and Guptill taps it... all the way to the square leg boundary! Jeez, this outfield is insane. Also, tiny. That's only 60-odd metres.
a hint of swing outside the off stump, with Bhuvi pitching it up. The batsman shoulders arms
straying again, but this time Guptill picks out long leg with his flick
tucks him up with a back of a length ball on off stump, Munro keeps it out
presses forward to defend a fuller delivery on off stump
leading edge as Guptill gets into position for a flick shot before the ball arrives and as a result it wanders out to cover
appeal for lbw but there's an inside edge as Guptill eases forward to defend around off stump

huge lbw appeal as Guptill shoulders arms. India don't go for the review saying it was too high, signalling to a spot on his thigh. Insane batting from the opener. Even if the good length ball hadn't nipped back in, that is way too close to the off stump. Guptill lifts the bat high over his head. Then looks straight at the umpire deciding his fate. Shaun George says no. Ooooh, that was close!

plays on!. Reward for ridiculously good line and length. And honestly, it almost seems as if Guptill hasn't been picking Shami out the hand. Hasn't been comfortable with the way the ball is coming out. This one hits a length on and around off stump and wobbles back into the right-hander, he's too slow with his forward defensive and it piggy-backs off an inside edge and crashes into the stumps. Hundredth ODI wicket for Shami - the fastest by an Indian in ODIs
lovely bowling! It's full. It's on target. It forces Williamson to respect it with a straight bat held in soft hands
back of a length on off stump, taps it to cover point
full and outside off, crunches it to mid-off
nice and tight, never giving the left-hander any room. Munro has to stay patient and he's showing he can, defending the ball with gusto
whips it away to square leg! That's his shot. The one he plays as he wakes up groggy from sleep, barely aware of what he is doing. Gets the ball on his hips, swings it away with class
off the bottom of the bat! But again, this is a small ground with a fast outfield and Munro has taken care to loft the ball over mid-off
back of a length on middle, Munro knocks it to midwicket
shooooooootttt!. That is just pristine, like the first dew drop on a misty morning. Sees the ball pitched up outside off and leans into the cover drive, picking the gap to the left of mid-off
gets off his feet to deal with a shorter delivery outside off, and having allowed it to come to him, he's able to flick it to mid-on for a single

through him! It's his first ball from round the wicket and it's enough! Delicious bowling. And all this havoc is because of seam movement. And that too only about an inch or two. Shami usually presents the seam so beautifully. It comes down bolt upright as he hits a fuller length, outside off, drawing the left-hander to drive away from his body. That's because Munro's feet aren't quite covering for that deadly bit of movement and when that happens, you have to be circumspect with your shots. Munro isn't, and he pays for it
greets him with a short ball, which Taylor is wary of, dropping his hands and letting it through to the keeper
fullish and outside off, Taylor covers the line with a stride forward and defends stoutly
a hint of room on offer, but Taylor is too early at the crease to go for his patented cut shot. Slices it instead to cover

the length is so good that even Williamson is rooted to the crease - much like Munro - but the difference is, New Zealand's captain lets the ball come to him, managing his errors better, and finding a single to third man. India should think about cutting that glide out. Sri Lanka did it to decent effect in the last series
his bat comes around his front pad, which is perfectly in line with the stumps. Taylor needs to get bat on this fuller delivery and he does
presses forward outside off to push the ball to cover

Too good! He gets the ball to straighten after pitching on a beautiful length - not too full to drive, nowhere near short either and far too close to off stump to leave. Taylor is drawn forward and then beaten like a drum
looms over the fuller ball, with his wrists cocked and that comes in handy as he flicks to mid-on
probing line again, on fourth or fifth stump, Taylor turns it to midwicket
nearly drags on! That happened in the Sri Lanka series too. Williamson playing with soft hands to get the single to third man and instead nearly guiding the ball onto his stumps
back of a length and outside off, blocks to point
gets in line with a shortish delivery on off stump and blunts it

just short of point! It's Kohli there - in Jadeja's place had he been in the XI - and he comes into play because of a poor shot from Williamson. He wants to break the shackles put on him by that gully fielder. Sees a ball full and nice and wide outside off. Throws his hands at it and is nearly out
bouncer now, and Williamson ducks under it
fullish and outside off, Williamson blocks towards gully and that ends a maiden, his second in three overs.
gets forward to defend a good length ball outside off
gets the room he likes, cuts it away, with his trademark power too, but he still can't beat the field. India doing especially well. Their lines this afternoon have been so constricting
off the mark finally with a flick through midwicket - has to take a risk though playing that shot to a ball pitched up outside off
defends a good length ball outside off to the left of point
leaps off his feet to try and get on top of the bounce of this back of a length delivery outside off. And as well as he's hit it, he finds the cover fielder
ties him down in that off-stump corridor, and Williamson can only glide it to point
bouncer again, rising up over the back shoulder. Taylor thinks about the hook shot, then knowing that if he plays that he runs the risk of top-edging the shot, pulls out
draws him forward with a full delivery outside off, Taylor defends to cover
brings the bat down across his pads and endures a leading edge as Shami gets a fuller delivery to straighten off the angle
steps out of his crease, forcing the bowler to go short, and Taylor's ready with a flick shot through square leg
width and that's enough for Taylor! He's on the front foot, but he picks the poor length early, shifts his weight back a touch and then pummels it through midwicket. Insanely good pull shot

looks for lbw with the fuller ball, Taylor manages to turn it to the left of short midwicket, Rayudu's lurking there and he has a good opportunity to run the batsman out at the non-strikers.... if he'd managed to pick the ball up
there's that invaluable gully fielder in play again - Williamson runs the back of a length ball down, looking for third man, but that exit's barred
shimmies down the pitch, but Bhuvneshwar doesn't give Taylor any options but a defensive push. No room. Not the length for the drive.
goes a bit wide of the crease for a shortish delivery on off stump, Taylor knocks it down

launches it over mid-on and it nearly carries all the way! Exquisite strike from Taylor, coming down the pitch to Bhuvneshwar, picking up a length ball and putting it on a one-way trip into the stands.
taps a shortish delivery to point
a hint of movement away from the bat, but Taylor covers it by playing late and opening the face. No runs though, finds point
fuller delivery, he pushes to the right of mid-off
full on middle, he nudges it to the right of short midwicket, but not with the pace to beat the man. It's Dhawan there now, after Rayudu's misfield last over
good length on off stump, defends towards the covers
steps out, and then, since the bowler changes his length, going short, he waits on the ball and then taps it to third man
fullish on off stump, defends stoutly
good length, outside off, he glides it, looking for third man, but the point fielder is alert enough.
punches the fuller delivery straight back at the bowler
tosses it up, daring Taylor to drive, and drive he does, without timing it. Why? Cause the legbreak dips sharply on him.
shortish on off stump, he makes room and crashes it through point
flatter delivery on middle, Williamson goes back and punches it through to long-on
drifts into the pads, Taylor looks a little wary about the turn the wristspinner might extract, playing a circumspect flick to square leg
room to play the cut again and Taylor rarely needs a second invitation
leans into the flighted delivery outside off and taps it to long-off

run-out at the non-strikers?. It's a ricochet off the straight drive and we're headed up to the third umpires' box. And replays show Taylor's been good enough to rush back into his crease. Perfect straight drive almost results in disaster for NZ
shortish on off stump, Williamosn works it through midwicket
lashes the short and wide delivery to point. That's a poor ball. It should have been to be dealt with and I'm so angry I (almost) ended a sentence with a preposition
fullish on off stump, defends towards mid-off
full on off stump, Taylor moves across his crease a bit and nudges it to mid-on
gets those wrists going, flicking the short ball outside off to short midwicket
goes for the cut shot, but there's enough protection there, Vijay Shankar covers it well enough

loopy delivery on off stump, and Taylor is ready to lash it through cover, bringing all of his considerable power to play. But the ball dips again. Too sharply for him to go through with the shot. And so he brings his wrists into it to keep the ball down
gets the single through sweeper cover
on the pads, Williamson rocks back, waiting for it till the last second before whipping it through midwicket

has the ball stopping on Taylor - and turning just a touch too. Brings about a false shot as Taylor tries to find a single straight down the ground and instead has to settle for one off the leading edge to long-off. Dhoni immediately responds saying 'good bowling, Chahal'
he does that A LOT! Cuts the ball so hard that it bounces - off the other pitches in the square - right over the point fielder. Sensational bottom-hand strength
full and outside off, he drives into the covers, where Rayudu again misfields and he's banished ot another part of the ground. Mid-on, it looks like

that's breathtaking! It doesn't look like a boundary. Not at first. Not when he's barely put anything behind the strike. But this is Williamson. And it is his trademark backfoot punch. And the timing is usually out of this world.
taps the back of a length delivery down the pitch
doesn't come onto the bat as much as he'd like and so the backfoot punch wanders away aimlessly to cover
full and outside off, he drives to mid-on
he's getting drift now. The tossed up ball starts on off stump and then curls in through the air, forcing Taylor to defend
and again, even with Taylor making room to drive the ball through cover, Chahal gets the legbreak to drift into the right-hander, dip before he can get to the pitch and stymie him beautifully

he's claiming a caught and bowled! And replays show he's right. Exceptional bowling. This is the result of the other trick in his bag - change of pace. And it's almost like he's sensed his moment. Taylor's been itching to smash Chahal. But the legspinner's been too good with his drift and dip. Now the batsman has to make a choice. Take a risk. He comes dancing out of his crease. Chahal is ready for it. Pulls his length back. Draws his pace down. Doesn't let Taylor anywhere near the ball and the shot - a tame push down the pitch - results in a low catch, which he takes diving forward. Insaaaaaaanely good.
length at middle stump, nudged into the leg side off the back foot
short of a length, slow and turning down leg. Gets down early for the sweep and paddles it fine
length at off stump, blocked on the front foot
length and some shape away in the corridor. Blocked on the front foot

shot. Lovely hands. Short of a length and just outside off. Slightly shorter than the one he punched to the extra cover boundary in the 14th over. This time he shuffles to get behind the line and rolls the wrists to beat fine leg to his left
more wrist action. Short of a length,just outside off. Doesn't even shuffles this time. Just gets on top and whips to deep square's right. Chahal runs in and fumbles, allowing an easy second
length at off stump, blocked solidly on the front foot
full at middle stump, punched firmly on the up to mid-on

dropped! Are you kidding me! Both Williamson and Kedar Jadhav with shockers there. Short ball at leg stump, crouches and spanks it firmly - but straight to Jadhav at fine leg. It's low, but it's straight at him and he isn't a very tall man in any case. Had his hands behind this with knees on the floor. But couldn't hold on. A bit reckless from KW
length at leg stump, defended into the leg side
short of a length just outside off, cut to sweeper cover
length at leg stump, flicks with soft hands to leg slip
short of a length at leg stump, clipped to deep backward square off the back foot
length at middle stump, punched to long-on off the back foot
length at off stump, gets forward and flicks to long-on's left
short of a length and sliding across off stump, backs away and is beaten on the cut
length at off stump, punched back to the bowler off the back foot
seductive length from Kuldeep. Dips on KW outside off and he's pushing far, far in front of his body as he's beaten in flight. Just manages to stab it into the covers. Lost balance there
length at middle stump, driven to long-on
tossed up at off stump, doesn't get to the pitch as he looks to drive. It rolls down the pitch off the inside half
length at leg stump, controlled sweep to long leg's left
short of a length at leg stump, punched to deep square's left off the back foot
length outside off, defended with soft hands to short third
floated up at leg stump, tapped to long-on
oh lovely. Superb limited-overs batting. Full at middle stump, gets the front leg out to the pitch of it and just picks it up over midwicket with the turn. Safe, attacking, classy

return catch has been sent upstairs with soft signal out. This is a full ball the Latham doesn't get to the pitch of. Wants to drive to long-on, but he chips it to Chahal's left. It dips on the legspinner as he takes that. He isn't moving forward, per se, just sort of falling to his left...but third umpire is convinced he's got fingers under this. Didn't take too long for that decision. One look from the extra cover angle, one from front on, and Nigel Llong has seen enough evidence to go with the soft signal. Chahal does it again with his loop. And backs it up with his catching. Brilliant spell
short of a length at middle stump, punched to long-on off the back foot
length at middle stump, flicked to mid-on's left
dipping full ball at off stump, driven to long-off's left off the toe-end
googly beats him and gets him on the front pad. But he has a big stride on the forward defence as this hits him on the knee roll in front of leg stump
short of a length at off stump, punched to sweeper cover
short of a length and sliding across off stump, beaten on the late cut
length at middle stump, punched to long-on off the back foot
full on middle stump, tapped to long-on
length at leg stump, defended to midwicket off the inside edge
length at leg stump, steps out and flicks to deep midwicket
length at leg stump, tapped to midwicket's left
into the gap. Not fully in control, but Williamson gets it where he wanted. Full and drifting down leg. Gets the front leg out and clips it over midwicket off the low part of the bat
proper connection this time. Short and turning away from off stump. Gets on his back knee and swivels as he pulls to the midwicket boundary
dropped short and wide outside off. Sits back in the crease and slaps it past extra cover. 12 off 3 for New Zealand
length outside off, blocked into the off side
length outside off, driven to extra cover as it slides in
length and wide outside off, chops to sweeper cover
length outside off, drops it in front of short third with soft hands
yikes. Loopy rubbish wide outside off and Nicholls is probably shocked as he lets it go. Lands right on the wide marker and gives Dhoni and awkward take
length at middle stump, flicked through square leg with soft hands
full on leg stump, gets the front leg into the leg side and flicks to midwicket
floated up outside off, gets down and laps it towards long leg
full at middle stump, flicked straight to midwicket
full at middle stump, swept to long leg
googly cuts in slowly off the surface as Nicholls backs away. Punches to sweeper cover with all stumps exposed
length and sliding in at leg stump. Shoveled to long-on with the angle
length outside off, punched to extra cover
goes high arm and gets punished. Length at leg stump, slow and sitting up. Williamson takes his time and ramps it to the fine leg boundary
length at middle, punched to long-on
feigns a backhand flick at the non-striker's end but he might have done well to actually do it! This is driven firmly back at Jadhav and Williamson was struggling to get back in the crease

Kuldeep flies to his right and holds on at midwicket! Superb. Superb agility from Kuldeep. This is a slow length ball dipping at leg stump. Nicholls gets a lot of bat on this flick and it's whistling past Kuldeep as he sticks both hands out and takes it behind himself. Another New Zealand batsman goes trying to hit hard against slow bowling. He was overbalancing and falling over into the off side
full on off stump, driven to long-off
length and turning in at middle stump, blocked on the front foot
googly, length at middle, blocked down the pitch
full on off stump, driven to long-off
googly at a length outside off, defended to cover off the front foot
length and turning in at off stump. Punched to the bowler off the back foot
floated up full outside off, driven firmly, straight to extra cover
length at off stump, jabbed to point's left off the front foot
length ball outside off, mistimed punch to extra cover's left
full and leg stump, tapped to long-on off the front foot
full outside off, gets to the pitch and stabs it to long-off's left. That's the 36th ODI fifty for New Zealand and you can hear the applause. He's keeping them afloat
length and wide outside off, sliced on the bounce to cover point

pumps it over the long-on boundary! Santner with some stylish, albeit risky runs. Tossed up at leg stump. Gets the front leg into the leg side and uses his reach to club this over the boundary. Mid-on was in
googly, short of a length outside off, punched to sweeper cover
googly at middle stump. Picked. Drives with the turn to long-off
full on leg stump, defended towards the bowler
length ball sliding through outside off. Left alone
googly at off stump, blocked on the front foot
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper cover
bouncer at off stump, gets on top of it and fends into the off side
short and in at middle stump, cramped on the back foot as he defends down the pitch
length at off stump, blocked on the front foot
gets into the off side and fends off the top edge, to Dhoni's right. Late attempt at the pull from Santner, who realised this short ball was going down leg
length and in at middle stump, bat-pad into the covers
googly at a length outside off, punched to short extra cover
whack. Easy hit there. Dropped short at middle stump, Williamson swivels and slots it into the square boundary with a pull
full outside off, driven to long-off

sent upstairs for the stumping. And for catch behind. Beaten on the front as he looks to defend. He's in the crease as Dhoni makes the stumping. And Snicko confirms the sound was bat hitting the pad. India lose their review
length at off stump, defended to extra cover
length at off stump, stabbed to extra cover off the front foot
short of a length at off stump, punched to mid-off on the rise
short of a length just outside off, punched to sweeper's left off the back foot
length and in at middle stump, defended to midwicket off the inside half

that looks dead in front. He won't review it. Fantastic bowling again from Shami. Inside 10 balls, he's conjured a spell that has muddled Santner's thinking. He shuffles across and is deep in the crease after all the short balls he got last over. This is full, and in at middle stump. he looks to flick but is beaten for pace
bouncer at off stump, ducks under it
full outside off, driven to extra cover's left
short of a length outside off, punched to sweeper cover
short of a length outside off, punched to sweeper cover
short of a length just outside off, under-edge into the covers as he looks to cut
length outside off, jabbed into the off side
length at off stump, poked towards the bowler off the front foot
full outside off, flicked through midwicket
length ball wide outside off, gets down and paddles it to long leg's right
floated up outside off, driven to long-off
googly at a length outside off, defended off the back foot
length at off stump, driven to mid-off
googly at a length wide outside off, blocked on the front foot
length at off stump, blocked on the front foot
length and just outside off, tapped to extra cover off the back foot
short and wide outside off, chopped to sweeper's left
length at off stump, blocked on the front foot
length at off stump, steps out and jams to long-on
oh shot! Full at middle stump, gets to the pitch and drills it flat over the non-striker. Mid-on was in, good option
length at off stump, blocked on the front foot

taken at long-on! That might be it for New Zealand. There's the width for the shot - a loft straight down the ground - but Kuldeep manages to get the legbreak to dip just about enough that Williamson is left reaching out for it, outside off. That's enough to swindle his timing away from him and offer a simple catch to Vijay Shankar
nudges a tossed up delivery on off stump back to the bowler
stays back to the short ball - a googly - and cuts to cover
flighted delivery - nice and slow on off stump - and Bracewell defends

drags on! Doesn't pick the googly as he makes room to cut an assumed legbreak on off stump. The ball grips in the pitch, spins sharp enough that Bracewell is too far away from the ball to make any kind of decent contact. Lost for balance and panicking, Bracewell trusts only in his power and it fails him as he inside edges a short ball onto his stumps

huge lbw appeal but umpire George rules it not out and India have no reviews. This looks so close though. A tossed up googly that Ferguson can't read. He's lunging forward, playing for the one that turns into him, and is comfortably beaten on the outside edge. From there on, he's struck on the back pad in line with off stump. Is there too much spin there? Would it miss? Nope, replay shows three reds
tossed up on off stump, defends
that's a googly from the right-arm wristspinner, on middle, and Southee only just manages to get an inside edge to it
gets forward to block on middle.

dropped by Dhawan at long-off. He raises a hand in apology and if the match situation was different, it might not have been well received. Southee goes for the big hit - inside out over extra cover - but the connection is not quite enough
works a flighted delivery on off stump to midwicket
drives the tossed up ball, outside off, to long-off

appeal for stumping from Dhoni and that's usually tight. Gorgeous bowling from Kuldeep again. Looping the ball up for the lower-order bat. Pulling him forward to defend. Then, since it's the googly and Ferguson has not picked it, it spins right past the outside edge and straight into Dhoni's gloves. A millisecond later the stumps are broken with Ferguson's back leg on the line. Third ump Llong says off you go
loops it up outside off, Boult presses forward to block
googly again - that is so dangerous against the tail - and Boult only just gets an outside edge, playing inside the line
shimmies across his stumps to lap sweep a length ball from off stump behind square leg

another Dhoni appeal for stumping. Southee can't spot the wrong 'un either as he is made to reach too far from his body, a panicked cover drive. But that turn - the amount of turn - works against the bowler in the end, leaving even Dhoni with too long a distance to make the stumping in time
tossed up on off stump, defends

LOLZ! It's so much fun to see Boult bat. A down the track flamingo! He wanders down the pitch, looking for a big hit, Chahal bowls quicker, pulling his length back, and as a result Boult back tracks in double quick time, defending with the back leg in air
another swipe, after coming down the crease, at thin air, and a hasty rush back into the crease to escape the Dhoni stumping
googly! And Boult only just about gets bat to it. An inside edge, as he plays tentatively from the crease
tosses it up on off stump, defends like a boss.
beats him with the googly again, but this time Southee's feet are firmly planted behind the crease

that goes all the way. Those square boundaries are tiny and Sixer Southee nails the slog sweep. That's one shot where the batsman doesn't need to care about the turn. And for the record, this is turning the other way
flighted delivery on off stump, blocks
floats it up outside off, Southee drives to cover
goes back to read the googly off the pitch and taps it behind point

taken at slip! Four for Kuldeep. And India have only 158 as a target - the second innings will start immediately as well. No breaks. Right then, lets get to the ball: he goes round the wicket - on Dhoni's instructions - tosses it up to bring the batsman forward, gets it to turn the other way and secures the edge
starts with a loosener on the pads, Rohit works it behind square leg
squares him up with Dhawan planning to flick the straight delivery through midwicket and changing his mind late as the ball straightens. Leading edge goes to cover
good length outside off, Dhawan defends to point
fullish on off stump, Dhawan keeps it out
looks for the yorker, but Dhawan is ready for those tactics, picking the length well, staying nicely balanced as he pulls the front leg back and flicks to long leg
guides the short ball outside off safely to point
goes for the on-the-up cover drive - he's very good with it and having played out that first over, he also knows there's no swing. Good batting from Dhawan

very full, the ball tailing down leg, Rohit takes extra care to play straight, offering basically a leading edge when he could easily have flicked the ball over midwicket. To add to all that awkwardness, there's a near run-out chance with Dhawan looking for a single even as mid-off tracked the ball to his right
turns it to midwicket

a hint of seam movement - the same hints that made Shami so dangerous - but here Rohit is able to manage an inside edge and races across to the other end. The keeper, catching up with the ball at around leg gully, flings the throw and hits Rohit
slices a back of a length delivery to point, but that region is well patrolled
shortish and outside off, blocks towards point

hits all across the line, but umpire George bins the lbw appeal. A pitched-up delivery that the left-hander looks to swing over square leg. Doesn't straighten enough to hit the stumps. Replays suggest it would have been umpire's call
back of a length and outside off, taps it through cover
very full - and a tough wide outside off - Rohit gets down low with it and steers towards point

inside edge saves him and his stumps. Boult goes round the wicket, and gets his arm to go slingy as he releases the ball. That messes with Rohit's tracking of the ball, having him playing an expansive drive away from his body.
back of a length on off stump, defends
goes over the wicket now and a shortish delivery outside off is allowed to zip through to the keeper

late swing! And with Southee pitching the ball right up, this almost ends up being an indipping yorker. Dhawan does really really well to yank his feet out of the way and bring down a straight bat to protect his stumps
good length ball on off stump, defends
another rip-roaring, inswinging yorker! It starts on middle and veers into the right-hander like it's remote-controlled and Dhawan again is just about good enough to jam his bat down
great stuff from Santner, pushing off his left feet, diving full length to stop an on-the-up cover drive. Keeps Dhawan on strike. Keeps the pressure on

leading edge as Dhawan searches for an escape with a heave over midwicket. For half a second, this seems like it's gone straight up, but actually, the pace on this pitch, and from Southee's bowling, allows the ball to carry over the point fielder and roll over to the boundary
looks for the yorker again, but it becomes a full toss this time. Dhawan drives past mid-off
cramps him on off stump and Dhawan's push into the covers isn't good enough to get him the single
picks up the short ball, goes for the pull, but it doesn't bounce quite as much as he expects and he's beaten on the bottom edge
back of a length on and around off stump, Dhawan chops it down, looking for a quick single. Not there
slower ball - dipping on the left-hander, dipping so very sharply. Dhawan is pinned on leg stump as he plays all around his front pad and endures a loud lbw appeal. Would have gone down leg though
stands up tall to slide a back of a length delivery to point
gets right behind a short ball on off stump
neat cover drive from Dhawan, but the discipline of New Zealand's quicks is being backed up well by their field
shifts round the wicket and the full delivery outside off is carved behind point. That's 5000 ODI runs for Dhawan in 119 matches.

there's an easy flick through midwicket, but Rohit doesn't quite time the batswing right, and he knows it, shows his annoyance after the ball goes off his inside edge, onto his thigh pad and over to point
goes wide of the crease, searching for the blockhole and Rohit is able to dig it out.
steps out of his crease and launches the good length ball down the ground. Not perfectly timed, but once it's over the infield, no one's stopping that
outside edge as Southee gets a good length ball to straighten and Rohit gives it due respect, playing late and as close to the body as he could. Single to deep third man

he's not timing em! And it's apparent in this shot - a shot he's so good at - the front foot pull. Spots the short ball early enough but it comes onto him, bouncing a little too much for his liking, and he only just clears mid-on, running to his right
straying onto the pads and Dhawan whips it away to the square leg boundary. Pings the boundary boards before the bowler can even look up
good length outside off and he taps it into the covers for a quick single
slower ball, but he's into the forward defensive, a shade outside off, too early and as a result he gets an inside edge and worries about whether it's dragged onto his stumps
full on off stump, Rohit keeps it out well

goes for the slog - it's a length ball outside off, so it's there for the taking - but even the new ball seems to stick in the pitch just a tiny bit. Meaning Rohit is too early on the ball and he mistimes through midwicket
outstanding shot! More so because he keeps his front leg away - he needs to with the ball pitched up and swinging in late - and then trusts a straight bat to come down through the line
carves the back of a length delivery outside off to point
cross-seam slower ball from round the wicket, Dhawan picks it early and dabs it towards point
hits the gap between the two point fielders! Enough width on the ball for Dhawan to free his hands. It's short of length too, giving him that little extra time to place it properly
fuller delivery outside off, drives into the covers
works it towards the midwicket boundary, enjoying the ball angling into him from round the wicket
149 kph good length ball on off stump, Rohit deflects it to cover
goes wide of the crease for a back of a length delivery angling into off stump. The 147 kph delivery is punched through the covers. Rohit, so at ease against extreme pace
round the wicket for a shortish delivery at 150 kph, Dhawan glides it to point
slower ball - the leg roller it looks like - and Dhawan is beaten as he goes for the swat through point. Meanwhile, Ferguson goes from 150 kph to 129 kph
fullish on off stump at 149 kph, Dhawan drills it to cover
glorious batting! It comes down at 148 kph. More than enough pace for the glide ot third man. And with Ferguson dropping it short and wide, that's the simple, logical and perfect option
length outside off, punched on the up to mid-off
taken at slip! Loose waft from Rohit at a delivery curving away from him. It's short of a length, he's not gotten close to it with his feet and Guptill pouches in front of his face
length and just outside off. Late shape away. Defended on the front foot
bouncer down leg side, ducks under it
length outside off, punched firmly to cover's right on the up. Nice big stride out
length outside off, left alone
full and down leg side. Can't get bat on that as it whistles by
length and in at leg stump, flicked to mid-on's left
length ball pushed across off stump, defended to cover off the outside half
length just outside off, defended to cover
short at middle stump, defended into the leg side off the back foot
length outside off, poked wide of mid-off on the up
slower ball, wide outside off. Skids under the attempted drive
length ball shaping away outside off, driven on the rise to mid-off
length and just outside off. Defended off the back foot
length and in at leg stump, clipped to deep square
length at middle stump, uses his wrists to turn this down to fine leg

dropped! Latham calls and can't get there! Short ball at middle stump, too late on the pull. Ends up slicing it into the square leg region. Guptill allows Latham to go for it after hearing the call, although he was possibly closer at midwicket. Latham is never under it and is diving awkwardly forward and to his right as he lets this slip
length outside off, punched straight to extra cover on the up
shot! Length ball wide outside off, reaches out and lashes through the line to bisect cover and extra
short and up at the ribs. Fends uppishly into the leg side
short of a length at the hips, holds his ground and tickles it fine. No one stopping that
length at leg stump, flicked to deep square
length ball down leg side, beaten as he looks to glance it fine
length outside off, sliced to cover on the up
bouncer dug in too short. Gets out of the way and lets it pass
short and wide outside off, cut straight to point
short of a length at off stump, defended into the off side
short of a length at off stump, dropped pitch side on the off sdie with soft hands
length at leg stump, flicked to deep square's left
full and in at leg stump. Looks to flick and closes the face too early. Leading edge to mid-off. That was a legcutter
short and up at the hips. Falls into the off side and caresses this to fine leg
length outside off, tapped on the rise to mid-off's right
short ball slanted across off stump, jumps behind the line and wallops it over midwicket with a pull
brilliantly timed! 150kph ball, at a length outside off. Leans in at it and opens the face late to get his between point and third man
short of a length just outside off, opens the face and runs it to third man
attempted slower, full toss wide outside off. Mistimed slap at it and it trickles to mid-off's right. Taylor's throw from there is too wayward for Latham and they get an extra run at fine leg
short of a length outside off, looks to pull, gets an inside edge onto front leg
overpitched and in at leg stump. Looks to flick, cops it on the pad
short of a length outside off. Looks to chop it square, beaten on the outside edge
length at leg stump, whipped to long-on off the back foot
length ball down leg side, looks to sweep fine, beaten
length and down leg side, beaten on the sweep
yorker length just outside off, jammed down to long-off
length at leg stump, flicked to midwicket
in the air and just past extra cover's hand! Full ball outside off. Lots of room for Kohli and he swings hard at this. Hits it hard enough to escape extra cover's dive to the right
length at middle stump, punches to long-on
length at off stump, defended off the back foot
length at leg stump, flicked to deep square
length ball wide outside off, drive on the rise to sweeper
length at off stump, opens the face and runs it down to third man
short ball lifting up outside off. Left alone
short of a length outside off, cut to sweeper cover
length at leg stump, clipped to deep square off the back foot
short of a length outside off, sliced straight to backward point
full on off stump, driven straight to extra cover
length outside off, punched to extra cover on the up
length outside off, poked through cover on the rise
length on leg stump, flicked straight to midwicket
length at leg stump, flicked to midwicket
short at leg stump, pulls to deep square
length at off stump, defended off the back foot
yorker in at off stump, jammed down the pitch as it dips in late
short ball outside off, pulled along the floor to deep square
length outside off, leans in and defends to point
short of a length just outside off, defended to point
length at off stump, blocked down the pitch
short of a length and pushed across off stump. Steps out and hurriedly taps back to the bowler
length at off stump, down the pitch and driven to long-on
length at middle stump, punched to long-on off the back foot
length at middle stump, punched to long-on off the back foot
short of a length outisde off, chopped straight to backward point
short of a length outside off, chopped straight to point
length ball wide outside off, reaches out and slashes. Gets an under-edge to third man
short at middle stump, pulled to deep square
full and in at middle stump. Looks to drive through the leg side. Gets an inside edge onto pad
slower ball, full outside off. Reaches out and slices to sweeper cover
bouncer at middle stump, gets the hands up and pulls into the turf. Sufficiently to the left of Taylor at deep square for them to pinch the third
full on leg stump, flicked straight to midwicket
length outside off, driven to sweeper cover
full on middle stump, flicked to long-on
full on off stump, driven to long-off
length outside off, blocked into the covers on the front foot
length at middle stump, tapped into the leg side off the front foot
length outside off, flicked to mid-on
length at middle stump, tapped into the leg side
length at leg stump, tapped to midwicket
shot. But straight to the fielder at extra cover. Full and just outside off and a crisp connection on the drive
slower ball at a length outside off, leans in and drives to sweeper's left to bring up his 26th ODI fifty
length outside off, punched to sweeper cover
full on leg stump, flicked to midwicket
tossed up outside off, driven to extra cover
full outside off, whipped to long-on
length at leg stump, flicked to midwicket
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper's left. He puts in a slide to keep it to two
length at leg stump, flicked to midwicket's left
short of a length and wide outside off, looks to cut, beaten
short of a length outside off, cuts and finds point
slower ball, full outside off. Driven straight to mid-off

given lbw and Kohli reviews. Seems to be indicating he got bat on this. An attempted flick to a length ball that has struck him in front of middle. There is a disturbance on Snicko. He survives. Very thin edge there, if there was one. Because it didn't show on Hotspot.
length outside off, punched on the up to mid-off's left
length outside off, flicks to midwicket's left
shifts his weight back to deflect a slightly shortish delivery behind square leg
a neat little nudge smuggling the flighted ball on off stump away through square leg
gets a big front foot stride so he can get to the ball where it pitches on off stump and drive to long-on
a touch short this time and Dhawan rocks back to cut to deep point
the delivery full and outside off gets a sedate hit through the covers
waits on the ball, letting it spin in, before he cuts it through point
slower ball, short of a length, Dhawan adjusts to the change in pace and dabs it through point
turns a fuller delivery on middle away towards midwicket
short and wide, Dhawan hammers it away to the sweeper
flowing cover drive as Kohli lunges forward - 146 kph projectile hurtling at his body be damned - and thumps it straight to the fielder
back of a length and outside off, Kohli steers the 148 kph ball behind point
slanting into the pads at 147 kph, Dhawan stands tall and whacks it to deep square leg. Superb - and simple - roll of his wrists to enable the shot
slow through the air, hitting a length outside off, Dhawan presses forward to defend
full on middle, Dhawan closes the bat face as he brings it down to find a quick single past midwicket
lashes the full and wide delivery behind point, the bat completing a full circle - while being so close to the ground - as he brings his wrists into play
full and outside off, he drives to mid-off
taps a tossed up delivery to long-on
stands tall and swats a short ball outside off to long-on
thwacks a short and wide delivery to the left of the sweeper
stands up tall and drills the 144 kph delivery to cover - it's still rising when Kohli meets it and yet he somehow tops the bounce and keeps the timing
presses forward for a push down the ground, but Ferguson dives to his right in his followthrough to deflect the ball to mid-on and keep it to a dot

caught behind! The Ferguson short ball works. And that's largely because it climbs up to his badge. Kohli's the kind to take on the short ball. If only to show bowlers they won't have their way. He's got out this way before, especially when his body's the target and sometimes even when the bouncer is straying down leg - as this is. Goes for the hook and gets a thin tickle through to the keeper.

between keeper and slip! Taylor is wide, at second slip, if he'd been at orthodox first slip, that would have been a dolly. This is Rayudu not fancying Ferguson's pace. His feet aren't moving. Goes searching for a good length ball outside off and offers a thick edge that should really have been gobbled up. Latham tries his best, diving to his right, but he is never getting there
short ball again - outside off this time - Rayudu looks to guide it to third man but can't touch it
crunches the shortish delivery outside off through cover
shuffles across and works a back of a length ball on leg stump through square leg
back of a length on off stump, Rayudu gets behind it
fuller delivery outside off, Rayudu lets it go
squares him up with a little bit of movement off the seam. Rayudu though is able to cover it, on around off stump, with soft hands and a straight(ish) bat
blocks the short ball into the off side
works a full delivery on the pads - at 149 kph - through to deep square leg
full and outside off, he drives to a deepish mid-off. Dhawan's looking for a single, but Rayudu says now and he just about makes his time before the throw
back of a length and outside off, and yet he goes for an on the up drive, off the front foot. Looks all sorts of odd as the ball beats his edge
drives straight to cover
gets forward to another short of a length delivery and taps it into the covers for a quick single
127 kph - the Lockie Ferguson slower (short) ball, which Dhawan punches through the covers
nearly plays on. Dhawan's attempt to block the good length ball on middle stump with soft hands almost goes wrong with Bracewell getting just a tiny bit of movement into the left-hander
back of a length and outside off, Dhawan plops it into the covers
slower ball, on a full length outside off, Dhawan eases it to point

whip-pulls the short ball coming for his face nearly all the way to the midwicket boundary. Whip-pulls because the bat doesn't really go horizontal and there's barely any followthrough. It's like he's guiding the ball away with the face pointed straight up
tucks it past square leg
good length on off stump and with the ball straightening off the seam Rayudu has to be careful once again
144kph, shortish on middle, Dhawan gets inside the line to guide it through to point
spots the short ball early, waits until it's close to his body and then ramps it off middle stump to deep third man
charges out of his crease and is beaten on the outside edge as he plays too far inside the line.
quick run to square leg, Taylor's there, getting to the ball quickly enough, even hitting the stumps direct, but Dhawan's well safe. Great running
full and outside off, Dhawan drags it to midwicket

another sharp bouncer - at 141 kph - rising up above Dhawan's chest and looking for his badge. The batsman does well though, swaying away from the line, and guiding the ball past the vacant gully region
works the shortish delivery on middle and leg through square leg
shortish and on off stump, taps it down the pitch
goes for the pull to a short ball down leg, doesn't connect
shortish and outside off, taps into the covers
full on off stump, defends
bouncer, on middle stump, gets out of the way
steps out of his crease but Bracewell keeps following him, tucking him up and Rayudu can only push it to cover
good length, outside off, punches to mid-off
steps out and launches the length ball outside off over cover. Scores tied
full and outside off, defends
steers a back of a length delivery to point
slower ball, Rayudu drops it in front of point, Dhawan responds for the single and India win!
